title: [Keycloak] admin-client dont enable user
body:
### Describe the bug

The following sends the new /existing user to Keycloak.
Here you can also activate the user.

```
UserResource userResource = usersRessource.get(user.getId());
UserRepresentation kcUser = userResource.toRepresentation();
kcUser.setEnabled(Boolean.TRUE);
userResource.update(kcUser);

```


but it still remains deactivated and you cannot log in. You must then activate the user manually in Keycloak.

### Expected behavior

after creating/updating the user should be active in Keycloak.

### Actual behavior

the user is deactivated in Keycloak and cannot log in.

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

17.0.5

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

gradlew --7.2

### Additional information

_No response_
